A4.text: In 2020, 62.3% of the population of Switzerland were native speakers of German (either Swiss or Standard German) at home

A5.text: 0.5% Romansh. The German region (Deutschschweiz) is roughly in the east, north, and centre; the French part (la Romandie) in the west; and the Italian area (Svizzera italiana) in the south.

A6.text: Switzerland, co-official at the federal level with French, Italian, and Romansh, and at the local level in four cantons: Bern (with French), Fribourg (with French), Grisons (with Italian and Romans JAVA) and Valais (with French)

A7.text: Swiss Standard German is used in the Swiss education system
